result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kailex FM Martin

records.addlTxt:
22CF44:
Atty Caucill states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court and has emailed copies to counsel.  Atty Caudill did receive the information electronically and waive the reading.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

1:10 PM Defendant Kailex FM Martin in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill in court for Kailex FM Martin.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF44 & 22CF90 tracking together:
Atty Juech states plea agreement to Count 1 in 22CF44.  22CF90 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Caudill agrees and states that they need to waive the Prelim in 22CF44.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of 22CF44 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
 22CF90 to be dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Caudill waives the request for a PSI.
Atty Juech makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Caudill makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  22CF44:  Withhold Sentence;  24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
AODA and any follow-up treatment
No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Random UA's as recommended by the Agent
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; conditional time
Report on or before December 9, 2022 by 7:00pm, clean & sober. 
Credit = 5 days (if revoked)
May transfer to Adams County
Electronic Monitoring authorized
Cash bond from 22CF90 to be applied to 22CF44.
Remainder of the Costs to be paid through Probation
Defendant is to contact the Probation office in Portage, WI by 4:00pm today 

**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

22CF90 to be dismissed and read-in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:24 PM Defendant Kailex FM Martin appeared by phone.  Attorney Eric Caudill appeared by video for Kailex FM Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF44 & 22CF90 tracking together:
BY THE COURT:  Warrants quashed.

Atty Caudill states that the defendant just forgot about the hearing.  

BY THE COURT:  Reinstate the bonds in both cases.

Atty Caudill states that there is a resolution in both matters; requests a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT;  Set plea/sentencing
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:46 PM Defendant Kailex FM Martin not in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill appeared by video for Kailex FM Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF90 & 22CF44 tracking together:
Atty Caudill states that he has not been able to get in touch with his client.
Atty Burdon requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue in both cases.

Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:17 AM Defendant Kailex FM Martin appeared by phone.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena appeared by video for Kailex FM Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears on behalf of the defendant for 22CF90.
22CF44 & 22CF90 tracking together:
Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.

10:24am  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz states that Atty Caudill will take both cases.  Atty Caudill is in agreement.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Based on the agreement; court grants the substitution of counsel on 22CF90

22CF90:
Atty Caudill states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  Atty Caudill waives time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing on 22CF90.
set status
Status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:17 PM Defendant Kailex FM Martin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Also appearing for today's hearing is Attorney Kathryn Hayes on behalf of the Public Defender's Office.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes. Court confirms address and phone. 
Atty Hayes states defendant does qualify for PD appointment.  Defendant states he is not sure if he will use the PD's office or use Atty Avena from another case.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and will be contacting counsel.
Atty Juech requests $250.00 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Hayes requests $100.00 cash bond.  
BY THE COURT:  Court sets $100.00 cash bond with conditions.  Set for IA
Initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
